What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.

Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List: I gained an incredible understanding of the basics of the Russian language. I learned many cultural norms and pronunciation tactics through the very educated guidance of my teacher.
A solid foundation of the principles and basics of Russian grammar and language.
We learned a lot of grammar and vocabulary, allowing basic conversation and sentence formation. Also I learned quite a bit about Russia, Russian history and culture!
I learned basic Russian vocabulary and grammar skills.

It would be helpful to be given essential vocabulary every unit, since the vocabulary at the end of each unit often included many terms that we were never tested on or used in class. Otherwise, the course was great. Also it would be good to mention earlier in the course some of the resources the book has (vocabulary at end of each unit, grammar analysis, appendices, etc.) and that you should be studying on your own every day. As someone that hasn't really taken a difficult language course before, I was thrown into the deep end and did not know I had to be doing things besides the assigned homework and readings if I wanted to succeed.
The strengths are in the class participation and community.

The course has many strengths. The mixture of quizzes and longer unit tests is a good way of testing knowledge and ensuring constant revision. The teaching by Liubov was fantastic. One thing that could be improved is I would have liked there to be more speaking in class. I wasn't able to make it to the Russian table times, and we did very little work on accent in class. I sometimes feel like I sound Italian when I try to speak Russian!
It was taught very well and straightforward from the textbook curriculum. The professor was also engaging and helped provide cultural context for lessons.

This course is awesome! The faculty in the Russian department is excellent, however it is not a gut language by any means. I don't recommend taking this class if you already have a full load because it certainly requires a lot of consistent time and effort. However, you will finish the course with a very good base level knowledge of the Russian language and it's a very interesting and rewarding language to know.
Yes! Russian is a lot of fun and a great language. The Russian program and teaching is really strong.
Yes because it was very interesting and a great introduction to the Russian language.
